Background:
They are non-binary, between the ages of 25 and 34. They have an associate degree and live in Portland, Oregon, with a partner and a small rescue dog. Financial Situation:
Their income is variable and sometimes unpredictable, so they prioritize building an emergency fund and tracking monthly expenses. They budget carefully for essentials and allocate a modest portion of earnings to savings and creative projects. They are open to affordable credit options but avoid high-interest debt.

Shopping Habits:
They shop online a few times per week, frequently browsing marketplaces and independent maker sites. Average monthly online spend is around $120–$200, with purchases including vintage clothing, art supplies, tech accessories, and eco-friendly household goods. They value ethical brands, transparent sourcing, and products with minimal packaging. They read reviews but also rely on community recommendations from social platforms. They enjoy discovering new small brands and are comfortable returning items that don't meet expectations.

Professional Life:
Their freelance design work is flexible and project-based; they juggle client deadlines with personal creative work. They cultivate a portfolio online and use networking at local events to find clients. They are motivated to grow into a sustainable creative practice and are exploring part-time remote roles to increase income stability.

Personal Style:
They have an eclectic, gender-neutral aesthetic that mixes thrifted finds with modern basics. Their routine includes morning coffee and a short photo walk, work sessions split between a home studio and local co-working spaces, and evenings spent editing photos, making zines, or attending shows. They prioritize mental health with regular therapy and community meetups.

They are non-binary and between the ages of 25 and 34. They have an associate degree and live in Austin, Texas, in a rented apartment with a roommate. They work part-time as a graphic designer and freelance on the side. They earn an annual personal income between $35,000 and $49,999. They enjoy attending local art shows, biking, and experimenting with plant-based cooking. They follow design trends, care about sustainability, and are optimistic about how technology can support creative work.

Financial Situation:
Their income is moderate and somewhat variable due to freelance work. They budget carefully for essentials and prioritize spending on creative tools, experiences, and sustainable products. They have a small emergency fund and plan to save more steadily over the next few years.

Shopping Habits:
They shop online a few times per month and typically spend around $80–$150 a month. They prefer independent brands and marketplaces that highlight ethical production. They are confident buying stationery, art supplies, and eco-friendly clothing online. They read reviews and check return policies but are open to discovering new brands via social media and design blogs. They value high-quality, durable items and are willing to pay a premium for sustainable manufacturing.

Professional Life:
They balance part-time work at a local design studio with freelance projects for small businesses. They prioritize creative freedom and portfolio growth. They use online tools for collaboration, client management, and selling prints. They seek networking opportunities in local meetups and online communities to expand their client base.

Personal Style:
They have an eclectic, gender-neutral wardrobe with a focus on comfort and sustainability. Their day typically starts early with a short bike ride, followed by flexible work hours. Evenings are spent experimenting with new plant-based recipes, sketching, or attending a gallery opening. They enjoy low-key socializing with friends and contributing to community art projects.
intent: Buy the highest rated product from the meat substitute category within a budget between 100 and 200. You don't need to finish the purchase, just go to the checkout page.

persona:
Background:
She is a female between the ages of 25 and 34. She has a bachelor's degree and lives in Portland, Oregon, in a one-bedroom apartment. She works as a freelance graphic designer and earns an annual household income between $50,000 and $74,999. She enjoys hiking, plant care, and indie music. She is interested in sustainability and believes technology can help solve environmental challenges when used thoughtfully. She’s excited about creative tools powered by AI but cautious about privacy implications.

Financial Situation:
Her income varies month-to-month due to freelance work, but she manages a budget that prioritizes rent, healthcare, and savings for slow months. She’s careful with discretionary spending and allocates part of her income to a small emergency fund and occasional splurges on experiences like weekend getaways.

Shopping Habits:
She shops online a few times per month and typically spends around $80–$120 a month. She values sustainable and ethically made products and often reads product reviews and checks brand practices before purchasing. She prefers independent and niche brands over big-box retailers and is moderately influenced by social media recommendations from creators she trusts.

Professional Life:
She runs her own freelance design business, balancing client projects with marketing and invoicing. She values flexibility and autonomy, often working from coffee shops or co-working spaces. She continuously upskills through online design workshops and communities to stay current with industry trends.

Personal Style:
Her style is casual and thoughtfully curated — comfortable, eco-friendly clothing with a touch of vintage. Her routine starts early with a morning walk or quick hike, followed by focused work blocks, client calls in the afternoon, and creative side projects or local shows in the evening. She prioritizes work-life balance and time outdoors.

persona:
Background:
He is a male between the ages of 25 and 34. He has a bachelor's degree in graphic design and lives in Austin, Texas, in a one-bedroom apartment. He works as a freelance UX/UI designer and earns an annual household income between $50,000 and $74,999. He is passionate about visual storytelling, skateboarding, and indie music. He follows design trends closely, attends local meetups, and experiments with side projects that combine art and technology. He is optimistic about AI tools for creative work but cautious about losing the human touch.

Financial Situation:
His freelance income fluctuates month to month; some months are comfortable while others require tighter budgeting. He prioritizes paying rent and health insurance, sets aside a modest emergency fund, and occasionally invests in new hardware or courses to grow his skills.

Shopping Habits:
He shops online a few times per week, buying a mix of practical items and impulse finds. Monthly spend varies but averages around $150–$300, often on apparel, gadgets, creative tools, and vinyl records. He values fast, free shipping and detailed product images. He reads reviews and checks return policies but is more willing than average to try new brands if aesthetic and community buzz appeal to him. Social media and influencer recommendations influence him moderately.

Professional Life:
As a freelance UX/UI designer, he juggles multiple clients, project deadlines, and networking to maintain steady work. He values flexibility and autonomy, works remotely from coffee shops or co-working spaces, and continually learns new design systems and prototyping tools. He balances client work with personal creative projects that help build his portfolio.

Personal Style:
He favors a casual, urban look—graphic tees, lightweight jackets, slim jeans, and comfortable sneakers. He starts his day early with a coffee and a quick skate session, spends focused hours on design work, and uses evenings to attend local shows or collaborate with other creatives. He enjoys experimenting with new software, listening to podcasts about design and entrepreneurship, and taking short weekend trips to recharge.
